workflow.name: Sync HighLevel CRM to Google Sheets with GPT-4o daily reports via Gmail
workflow.description:
## üìò Description: This workflow automates a complete CRM ‚Üí Sheets ‚Üí AI ‚Üí Email reporting pipeline for HighLevel opportunities. It fetches fresh opportunity data from HighLevel, validates and normalizes every record, syncs all structured opportunities into a Google Sheet, merges them into a single dataset, and then uses GPT-4o to generate a clean, Gmail-friendly HTML report summarizing all opportunities for the day. Finally, it emails the formatted report directly to the sales inbox‚Äîcreating a fully automated, zero-touch Daily Opportunity Insight System. Invalid or incomplete CRM entries are logged automatically, ensuring data hygiene and auditability. ## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step) ‚ñ∂Ô∏è When Clicking ‚ÄòExecute Workflow‚Äô (Manual Trigger) Starts the daily reporting pipeline manually or on schedule. üì• Fetch Opportunities from HighLevel CRM Retrieves the latest opportunities (limit = 5) from HighLevel along with company, contact, source, and pipeline metadata. Acts as the primary CRM input. üîç Validate Opportunity Data Payload (IF Node) Checks whether each record contains a valid id. ‚úÖ Valid ‚Üí proceed to extraction and normalization ‚ùå Invalid ‚Üí sent to Google Sheets for cleanup ‚ö†Ô∏è Log Invalid Opportunities to Google Sheets Saves corrupt or incomplete CRM payloads into an error sheet. Supports CRM maintenance and future corrective actions. üßæ Extract Key Fields from HighLevel Data (Code Node) Pulls only essential fields from each opportunity: id, name, company, email, phone, source, assignedTo, pipelineId, stageId, tags, monetaryValue, and timestamps. Produces a simplified, uniform data structure. üõ† Normalize Opportunity Structure (Code Node) Cleans and standardizes each opportunity‚Äôs schema: ensures consistent field naming, fills contact info when nested, resolves pipeline/stage fields, and finalizes structure for sheet update. üìä Update Opportunity Records in Google Sheets Upserts (append/update) each opportunity into the ghl database tab of sample_leads_50. Matching key: id Keeps HighLevel CRM and Google Sheets fully synced. üß© Merge All Opportunities into a Single JSON Array Combines every normalized opportunity into one array named opportunities. This consolidated payload is passed to GPT-4o for table generation. üß† Configure GPT-4o Model (Azure OpenAI) Initializes GPT-4o as the AI engine responsible for generating the final HTML summary. üìÑ Generate Daily Opportunity Summary Report (AI Agent) GPT-4o transforms the merged opportunity dataset into a structured HTML report:

Daily Opportunity Summary

A short descriptive paragraph A full-width Gmail-friendly table with padded cells Header background #f5f5f5 Columns in fixed order: Name, Company, Email, Phone, Source, Pipeline ID, Stage ID, Value, Created At All nulls replaced with ‚Äú‚Äì‚Äù Output is pure HTML‚Äîno markdown. üìß Send Daily Opportunity Summary via Gmail Emails the final HTML report to the internal sales inbox with subject: ‚ÄúDaily Opportunity Report ‚Äì Summary of New Leads‚Äù Optimized for Gmail + Outlook rendering. ## üß© Prerequisites HighLevel OAuth connection Azure OpenAI GPT-4o credentials Google Sheets OAuth (Techdome account) Gmail API connection for report delivery ## üí° Key Benefits ‚úÖ Automatic syncing of HighLevel CRM opportunities into Sheets ‚úÖ AI-generated HTML dashboards without manual formatting ‚úÖ Clean, readable daily insights for sales teams ‚úÖ Built-in error logging for bad CRM records ‚úÖ Zero manual intervention required after setup ## üë• Perfect For Sales & Growth Teams using HighLevel CRM Operations teams maintaining CRM hygiene Agencies needing daily pipeline visibility Organizations wanting automated AI-generated opportunity summaries

parameters.subject: =Daily Opportunity Report ‚Äì Summary of New Leads

parameters.text:
=You are given an array of opportunities in JSON format below. Use ONLY this data. Do NOT guess, invent, fill missing fields, or add any extra information. If a field is null, replace it with "-". Input JSON: {{ JSON.stringify($json["opportunities"], null, 2) }} Your task: Generate a clean HTML report summarizing these opportunities. STRICT RULES: - Output ONLY VALID HTML (no markdown, no backticks). - Use a simple, clean, Gmail-friendly table. - Include ALL rows exactly as they appear. - Column order must be: Name, Company, Email, Phone, Source, Pipeline ID, Stage ID, Value, Created At HTML requirements: -

Daily Opportunity Summary

- A small description paragraph - A bordered table with header background (#f5f5f5) - Padding 8px in cells - Full width table - Use ‚Äú-‚Äù for null values

options.systemMessage: =You must not invent or guess data. All values must come only from the user-provided JSON. Output only valid HTML with no markdown or code blocks.

parameters.content:
## üìä AI-Powered HighLevel ‚Üí Google Sheets Sync & Daily HTML Report Workflow (GPT-4o + Gmail)  
This workflow syncs CRM opportunities from HighLevel into Google Sheets and automatically creates a daily HTML summary email using GPT-4o.

### üîπ Workflow Overview
1Ô∏è‚É£ Fetch opportunities from HighLevel CRM  
2Ô∏è‚É£ Validate records for completeness  
3Ô∏è‚É£ Extract & normalize key fields  
4Ô∏è‚É£ Update opportunities in Google Sheets  
5Ô∏è‚É£ Merge all data into a single array  
6Ô∏è‚É£ Use GPT-4o to create an HTML sales summary table  
7Ô∏è‚É£ Email the final report to the sales team  

### üîπ Tools & Integrations
- HighLevel CRM ‚Üí Opportunity data source  
- Google Sheets ‚Üí Data storage  
- Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o) ‚Üí AI report generator  
- Gmail ‚Üí Automated daily summary delivery  
- JavaScript Nodes ‚Üí Data cleaning and transformation

## üîó Fetch Opportunities from HighLevel CRM  
Pulls recent opportunity data (limit: 5 by default) from your HighLevel CRM account.  
Includes contact details, company, source, and stage info.  
This is the main data entry point.

## üß© Validate Opportunity Data Payload  
Checks whether each opportunity record has a valid ‚Äúid‚Äù field.  
‚úÖ Valid ‚Üí moves to extraction  
‚ùå Invalid ‚Üí logged into Google Sheets for review.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Log Invalid Opportunities  
Stores invalid or incomplete opportunities in a dedicated Google Sheet.  
Useful for cleaning CRM data and tracking integration issues.

## üßæ Extract Key Fields from HighLevel Data  
Extracts only the essential details from CRM opportunities, including:  
- id, name, company, email, phone  
- source, assignedTo, pipelineId, stageId  
- tags, monetary value, timestamps  
Simplifies data for consistency before sheet update.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Normalize Opportunity Structure  
Ensures every opportunity has standardized field names.  
Fills missing contact info, adjusts IDs, and prepares for sheet update and reporting.

## üß† Merge All Opportunities  
Combines all normalized records into a single JSON array under the field `opportunities`.  
Prepares data for AI processing and HTML report generation.

## üìã Update Opportunity Records in Google Sheets  
Upserts (append or update) opportunity data into the ‚Äúghl database‚Äù tab inside your master sheet (`sample_leads_50`).  
Matching key: `id`.  
Keeps CRM and sheet data fully synced.

## üß† Generate Daily Opportunity Summary Report  
GPT-4o analyzes the merged opportunities JSON and generates a clean HTML report.  
Structure:
- <h2> title: ‚ÄúDaily Opportunity Summary‚Äù  
- Description paragraph  
- Styled table with:  
  Name, Company, Email, Phone, Source, Pipeline ID, Stage ID, Value, Created At  
- Nulls replaced with ‚Äú-‚Äù  
- Gmail-friendly design (bordered table, padded cells)

## üìß Send Daily Opportunity Summary via Gmail  
Sends the AI-generated HTML report to the sales inbox.  
Subject: ‚ÄúDaily Opportunity Report ‚Äì Summary of New Leads.‚Äù  
Automatically formatted for Gmail rendering.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Configure GPT-4o Model  
Connects to the Azure OpenAI GPT-4o model.  
Used as the AI engine for generating HTML reports and summaries.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
